# Read Write APIs


<a name="overview"></a>
## Overview
Draft Swagger specification for Read Write


### Version information
*Version* : v0.1


### Contact information
*Contact* : Claudio Viola  
*Contact Email* : claudio.viola@openbanking.org.uk


### URI scheme
*BasePath* : /open-banking  
*Schemes* : HTTPS


### Tags

* Complex Payment : Complex Payments endpoints
* Simple Payment : Simple Payments endpoints


### Produces

* `application/prs.openbanking.rwdata.v0.1+json`




<a name="paths"></a>
## Paths

***

<a name="setupcomplexpayment"></a>
### Setup a complex payment
```
POST /payments/complex
```


#### Description
Setup a complex payment (e.g. International other currency, bulk payment, recurring bulk payment)


#### Body parameter
Payload needed to setup a complex payment

*Name* : body  
*Flags* : required


|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**ControlSum**  <br>*optional*|Total of all individual amounts included in the group, irrespective of currencies.  <br>**Pattern** : `"^-?\\d{1,13}\\.\\d{1,5}$"`|string|
|**CreditTransferTransactionInformation**  <br>*required*|Provides information on the individual transaction(s) included in the message.|< [CreditTransferTransactionInformation](#setupcomplexpayment-credittransfertransactioninformation) > array|
|**DebtorAccount**  <br>*optional*|Unambiguous identification of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry will be made as a result of the transaction.|[DebtorAccount](#setupcomplexpayment-debtoraccount)|
|**DebtorAgent**  <br>*optional*|Financial institution servicing an account for the debtor.|[DebtorAgent](#setupcomplexpayment-debtoragent)|
|**MerchantCategoryCode**  <br>*optional*|Category code conform to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction.  <br>**Length** : `3 - 4`|string|
|**NumberOfTransactions**  <br>*optional*|Number of individual transactions contained in the payment information group.  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[0-9]{1,15}$"`|string|
|**PaymentInformationIdentification**  <br>*required*|Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction. Usage: the  instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**PaymentType**  <br>*optional*|Specifies the Open Banking payment type requested|enum (FutureDated, Immediate, RecurringAnnually, RecurringMonthly, RecurringQuarterly, RecurringWeekly)|
|**RequestedExecutionDate**  <br>*optional*|Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment. Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. If payment by cheque, the date when the cheque must be generated by the bank.  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[0-9]{4}-(0[1-9]\|(1[0\|1\|2]))-((0[1-9])\|((1\|2)[0-9])\|(30\|31))$"`|string|

<a name="setupcomplexpayment-credittransfertransactioninformation"></a>
**CreditTransferTransactionInformation**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Amount**  <br>*optional*|Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party.|[Amount](#payments-complex-post-amount)|
|**CreditorAccount**  <br>*required*|Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction.|[CreditorAccount](#payments-complex-post-creditoraccount)|
|**CreditorAgent**  <br>*required*|Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor.|[CreditorAgent](#payments-complex-post-creditoragent)|
|**EndToEndIdentification**  <br>*required*|Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction. It can be included in several messages related to the transaction.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**InstructionIdentification**  <br>*required*|Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction. Usage: the  instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**RemittanceInformation**  <br>*optional*|Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 140`|string|

<a name="payments-complex-post-amount"></a>
**Amount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**EquivalentAmount**  <br>*optional*|Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.|[EquivalentAmount](#payments-complex-post-amount-equivalentamount)|
|**InstructedAmount**  <br>*optional*|Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party. Usage: This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.|[InstructedAmount](#payments-complex-post-amount-instructedamount)|

<a name="payments-complex-post-amount-equivalentamount"></a>
**EquivalentAmount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Amount**  <br>*required*|Amount of money to be moved between debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and to be moved in a different currency. Usage: The first agent will convert the equivalent amount into the amount to be moved.|[Amount](#payments-complex-post-amount-equivalentamount-amount)|
|**CurrencyOfTransfer**  <br>*required*|Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account.  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[A-Z]{3}$"`|string|

<a name="payments-complex-post-amount-equivalentamount-amount"></a>
**Amount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Amount**  <br>*required*|**Pattern** : `"^-?\\d{1,13}\\.\\d{1,5}$"`|string|
|**Currency**  <br>*required*|A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[A-Z]{3}$"`|string|

<a name="payments-complex-post-amount-instructedamount"></a>
**InstructedAmount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Amount**  <br>*required*|**Pattern** : `"^-?\\d{1,13}\\.\\d{1,5}$"`|string|
|**Currency**  <br>*required*|A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[A-Z]{3}$"`|string|

<a name="payments-complex-post-creditoraccount"></a>
**CreditorAccount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|maxLength 34 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 34`|string|
|**Name**  <br>*optional*|maxLength 70 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 70`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.|enum (BBAN, IBAN)|

<a name="payments-complex-post-creditoragent"></a>
**CreditorAgent**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|maxLength 35 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Specifies the external financial institution identification scheme name code in the format of character string.|enum (BICFI, UKSortCode)|

<a name="setupcomplexpayment-debtoraccount"></a>
**DebtorAccount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|maxLength 34 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 34`|string|
|**Name**  <br>*optional*|maxLength 70 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 70`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.|enum (BBAN, IBAN)|

<a name="setupcomplexpayment-debtoragent"></a>
**DebtorAgent**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|maxLength 35 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Specifies the external financial institution identification scheme name code in the format of character string.|enum (BICFI, UKSortCode)|


#### Responses

|HTTP Code|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**200**|Payment setup successfully|[Simple Payment Setup Post Response](#simple-payment-setup-post-response)|
|**400**|Bad Request|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|
|**401**|Unauthorized|[HTTP 401 Error](#http-401-error)|
|**500**|Internal Server Error|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|

<a name="simple-payment-setup-post-response"></a>
**Simple Payment Setup Post Response**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**GlobalIntentID**  <br>*required*|Global Intent ID is the ASPSP identifier for the complex payment setup intent, It identifies one or more individual complex payment  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**PaymentReferences**  <br>*required*||< [PaymentReferences](#payments-complex-post-paymentreferences) > array|

<a name="payments-complex-post-paymentreferences"></a>
**PaymentReferences**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**EndToEndIdentification**  <br>*required*|Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction. It can be included in several messages related to the transaction.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**IntentID**  <br>*required*|Intent ID is the ASPSP identifier for the individual complex payment setup intent  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|

<a name="http-500-error"></a>
**HTTP 500 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The payment infrastructure is busy or unavailable.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (500)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (InternalServerError)|

<a name="http-401-error"></a>
**HTTP 401 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The request is unauthorised. Do not resubmit the request.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (401)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (Unauthorised)|

<a name="http-500-error"></a>
**HTTP 500 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The payment infrastructure is busy or unavailable.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (500)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (InternalServerError)|


#### Consumes

* `application/prs.openbanking.rwdata.v0.1+json`


#### Produces

* `application/prs.openbanking.rwdata.v0.1+json`


#### Tags

* Complex Payment


#### Security

|Type|Name|Scopes|
|---|---|---|
|**oauth2**|**[OAuth2Security](#oauth2security)**|payments:recurring_setup,payments:complex_setup|


***

<a name="cancelglobalcomplexpayment"></a>
### Cancel an already setup complex payment in bulk
```
DELETE /payments/complex/{GlobalIntentID}/cancel-all
```


#### Description
Cancels all bulk payment instructions, Only future dated / recurring complex payment can be cancelled


#### Parameters

|Type|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|---|
|**Path**|**GlobalIntentID**  <br>*required*|Global Intent ID of the previously set up complex payment|string|


#### Responses

|HTTP Code|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**200**|Payments instruction cancelled|[Simple Payment Cancel Delete 200 Response](#simple-payment-cancel-delete-200-response)|
|**400**|Bad Request|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|
|**401**|Unauthorized|[HTTP 401 Error](#http-401-error)|
|**500**|Internal Server Error|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|

<a name="simple-payment-cancel-delete-200-response"></a>
**Simple Payment Cancel Delete 200 Response**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**PaymentStatus**  <br>*required*|enum (Cancelled)|
|**PaymentStatusDescription**  <br>*optional*|enum (Payment instruction cancelled.)|

<a name="http-500-error"></a>
**HTTP 500 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The payment infrastructure is busy or unavailable.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (500)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (InternalServerError)|

<a name="http-401-error"></a>
**HTTP 401 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The request is unauthorised. Do not resubmit the request.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (401)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (Unauthorised)|

<a name="http-500-error"></a>
**HTTP 500 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The payment infrastructure is busy or unavailable.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (500)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (InternalServerError)|


#### Produces

* `application/prs.openbanking.rwdata.v0.1+json`


#### Tags

* Complex Payment


#### Security

|Type|Name|Scopes|
|---|---|---|
|**oauth2**|**[OAuth2Security](#oauth2security)**|payments:complex_cancel,payments:recurring_cancel|


***

<a name="submitcomplexpayment"></a>
### Submit a complex payment
```
PUT /payments/complex/{GlobalIntentID}/submit
```


#### Description
Submit a previously setup complex payment (e.g. International other currency, bulk payment, recurring bulk payment)


#### Parameters

|Type|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|---|
|**Path**|**GlobalIntentID**  <br>*required*|Global Intent ID of the previously set up complex payment|string|


#### Body parameter
Body parameters needed to submit a complex payment

*Name* : body  
*Flags* : required


|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**ControlSum**  <br>*optional*|Total of all individual amounts included in the group, irrespective of currencies.  <br>**Pattern** : `"^-?\\d{1,13}\\.\\d{1,5}$"`|string|
|**CreditTransferTransactionInformationWithIntent**  <br>*required*|Provides information on the individual transaction(s) included in the message.|< [CreditTransferTransactionInformationWithIntent](#submitcomplexpayment-credittransfertransactioninformationwithintent) > array|
|**DebtorAccount**  <br>*optional*|Unambiguous identification of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry will be made as a result of the transaction.|[DebtorAccount](#submitcomplexpayment-debtoraccount)|
|**DebtorAgent**  <br>*optional*|Financial institution servicing an account for the debtor.|[DebtorAgent](#submitcomplexpayment-debtoragent)|
|**GlobalIntentID**  <br>*required*|Global Intent ID is the ASPSP identifier for the payment setup intent  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**MerchantCategoryCode**  <br>*optional*|Category code conform to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction.  <br>**Length** : `3 - 4`|string|
|**NumberOfTransactions**  <br>*optional*|Number of individual transactions contained in the payment information group.  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[0-9]{1,15}$"`|string|
|**PaymentInformationIdentification**  <br>*required*|Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction. Usage: the  instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**PaymentType**  <br>*optional*|Specifies the Open Banking payment type requested|enum (FutureDated, Immediate, RecurringAnnually, RecurringMonthly, RecurringQuarterly, RecurringWeekly)|
|**RequestedExecutionDate**  <br>*optional*|Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment. Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. If payment by cheque, the date when the cheque must be generated by the bank.  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[0-9]{4}-(0[1-9]\|(1[0\|1\|2]))-((0[1-9])\|((1\|2)[0-9])\|(30\|31))$"`|string|

<a name="submitcomplexpayment-credittransfertransactioninformationwithintent"></a>
**CreditTransferTransactionInformationWithIntent**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**CreditTransferTransactionInformation**  <br>*required*||[CreditTransferTransactionInformation](#payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation)|
|**IntentID**  <br>*required*|Intent ID is the ASPSP identifier for the individual complex payment setup intent  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|

<a name="payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation"></a>
**CreditTransferTransactionInformation**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Amount**  <br>*optional*|Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party.|[Amount](#payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation-amount)|
|**CreditorAccount**  <br>*required*|Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction.|[CreditorAccount](#payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation-creditoraccount)|
|**CreditorAgent**  <br>*required*|Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor.|[CreditorAgent](#payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation-creditoragent)|
|**EndToEndIdentification**  <br>*required*|Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction. It can be included in several messages related to the transaction.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**InstructionIdentification**  <br>*required*|Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction. Usage: the  instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**RemittanceInformation**  <br>*optional*|Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 140`|string|

<a name="payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation-amount"></a>
**Amount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**EquivalentAmount**  <br>*optional*|Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.|[EquivalentAmount](#payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation-amount-equivalentamount)|
|**InstructedAmount**  <br>*optional*|Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party. Usage: This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.|[InstructedAmount](#payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation-amount-instructedamount)|

<a name="payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation-amount-equivalentamount"></a>
**EquivalentAmount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Amount**  <br>*required*|Amount of money to be moved between debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and to be moved in a different currency. Usage: The first agent will convert the equivalent amount into the amount to be moved.|[Amount](#payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation-amount-equivalentamount-amount)|
|**CurrencyOfTransfer**  <br>*required*|Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account.  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[A-Z]{3}$"`|string|

<a name="payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation-amount-equivalentamount-amount"></a>
**Amount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Amount**  <br>*required*|**Pattern** : `"^-?\\d{1,13}\\.\\d{1,5}$"`|string|
|**Currency**  <br>*required*|A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[A-Z]{3}$"`|string|

<a name="payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation-amount-instructedamount"></a>
**InstructedAmount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Amount**  <br>*required*|**Pattern** : `"^-?\\d{1,13}\\.\\d{1,5}$"`|string|
|**Currency**  <br>*required*|A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[A-Z]{3}$"`|string|

<a name="payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation-creditoraccount"></a>
**CreditorAccount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|maxLength 34 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 34`|string|
|**Name**  <br>*optional*|maxLength 70 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 70`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.|enum (BBAN, IBAN)|

<a name="payments-complex-globalintentid-submit-put-credittransfertransactioninformation-creditoragent"></a>
**CreditorAgent**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|maxLength 35 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Specifies the external financial institution identification scheme name code in the format of character string.|enum (BICFI, UKSortCode)|

<a name="submitcomplexpayment-debtoraccount"></a>
**DebtorAccount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|maxLength 34 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 34`|string|
|**Name**  <br>*optional*|maxLength 70 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 70`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.|enum (BBAN, IBAN)|

<a name="submitcomplexpayment-debtoragent"></a>
**DebtorAgent**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|maxLength 35 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Specifies the external financial institution identification scheme name code in the format of character string.|enum (BICFI, UKSortCode)|


#### Responses

|HTTP Code|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**200**|Payment executed or ready for scheme to execute.|[Complex Payment Submit Put 200 Response](#complex-payment-submit-put-200-response)|
|**400**|Bad Request|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|
|**401**|Unauthorized|[HTTP 401 Error](#http-401-error)|
|**500**|Internal Server Error|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|

<a name="complex-payment-submit-put-200-response"></a>
**Complex Payment Submit Put 200 Response**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**PaymentStatus**  <br>*required*|enum (ReadyforExecution)|
|**PaymentStatusDescription**  <br>*optional*|enum (Payment execution instruction accepted.)|

<a name="http-500-error"></a>
**HTTP 500 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The payment infrastructure is busy or unavailable.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (500)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (InternalServerError)|

<a name="http-401-error"></a>
**HTTP 401 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The request is unauthorised. Do not resubmit the request.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (401)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (Unauthorised)|

<a name="http-500-error"></a>
**HTTP 500 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The payment infrastructure is busy or unavailable.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (500)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (InternalServerError)|


#### Consumes

* `application/prs.openbanking.rwdata.v0.1+json`


#### Produces

* `application/prs.openbanking.rwdata.v0.1+json`


#### Tags

* Complex Payment


#### Security

|Type|Name|Scopes|
|---|---|---|
|**oauth2**|**[OAuth2Security](#oauth2security)**|payments:complex_submit,payments:recurring_submit|


***

<a name="cancelsinglecomplexpayment"></a>
### Cancel a single complex payment instruction
```
DELETE /payments/complex/{IntentID}/cancel
```


#### Description
Cancel a single complex payment instruction (e.g. International other currency, bulk payment, recurring bulk payment)


#### Parameters

|Type|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|---|
|**Path**|**IntentID**  <br>*required*|Intent ID of the previously set up simple payment|string|


#### Responses

|HTTP Code|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**200**|Payment instruction cancelled.|[Simple Payment Cancel Delete 200 Response](#simple-payment-cancel-delete-200-response)|
|**400**|Bad Request|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|
|**401**|Unauthorized|[HTTP 401 Error](#http-401-error)|
|**500**|Internal Server Error|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|

<a name="simple-payment-cancel-delete-200-response"></a>
**Simple Payment Cancel Delete 200 Response**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**PaymentStatus**  <br>*required*|enum (Cancelled)|
|**PaymentStatusDescription**  <br>*optional*|enum (Payment instruction cancelled.)|

<a name="http-500-error"></a>
**HTTP 500 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The payment infrastructure is busy or unavailable.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (500)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (InternalServerError)|

<a name="http-401-error"></a>
**HTTP 401 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The request is unauthorised. Do not resubmit the request.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (401)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (Unauthorised)|

<a name="http-500-error"></a>
**HTTP 500 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The payment infrastructure is busy or unavailable.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (500)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (InternalServerError)|


#### Produces

* `application/prs.openbanking.rwdata.v0.1+json`


#### Tags

* Complex Payment


#### Security

|Type|Name|Scopes|
|---|---|---|
|**oauth2**|**[OAuth2Security](#oauth2security)**|payments:complex_cancel,payments:recurring_cancel|


***

<a name="setupsimplepayment"></a>
### Setup a simple payment
```
POST /payments/simple
```


#### Description
Setup a simple payment (e.g. single immediate domestic payments, single future dated payment , single e-commerce payment or simple recurring payment)


#### Body parameter
Setup a simple payment

*Name* : body  
*Flags* : required


|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**CreditorAccount**  <br>*required*|Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction.|[CreditorAccount](#setupsimplepayment-creditoraccount)|
|**CreditorAgent**  <br>*required*|Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor.|[CreditorAgent](#setupsimplepayment-creditoragent)|
|**DebtorAccount**  <br>*optional*|Unambiguous identification of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry will be made as a result of the transaction.|[DebtorAccount](#setupsimplepayment-debtoraccount)|
|**DebtorAgent**  <br>*optional*|Financial institution servicing an account for the debtor.|[DebtorAgent](#setupsimplepayment-debtoragent)|
|**EndToEndIdentification**  <br>*required*|Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction. It can be included in several messages related to the transaction.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**InstructedAmount**  <br>*required*|Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party. Usage: This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.|[InstructedAmount](#setupsimplepayment-instructedamount)|
|**InstructionIdentification**  <br>*required*|Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction. Usage: the  instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**MerchantCategoryCode**  <br>*optional*|Category code conform to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction.  <br>**Length** : `3 - 4`|string|
|**PaymentType**  <br>*optional*|Specifies the Open Banking payment type requested|enum (FutureDated, Immediate, RecurringAnnually, RecurringMonthly, RecurringQuarterly, RecurringWeekly)|
|**RemittanceInformation**  <br>*optional*|Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 140`|string|
|**RequestedExecutionDate**  <br>*optional*|Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment. Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. If payment by cheque, the date when the cheque must be generated by the bank.  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[0-9]{4}-(0[1-9]\|(1[0\|1\|2]))-((0[1-9])\|((1\|2)[0-9])\|(30\|31))$"`|string|

<a name="setupsimplepayment-creditoraccount"></a>
**CreditorAccount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|maxLength 34 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 34`|string|
|**Name**  <br>*optional*|maxLength 70 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 70`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.|enum (BBAN)|

<a name="setupsimplepayment-creditoragent"></a>
**CreditorAgent**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|United Kingdom (UK) Sort Code - identifies British financial institutions on the British national clearing systems. The sort code is assigned by the Association for Payments and Clearing Services (APACS).  <br>**Pattern** : `"^SC[0-9]{6,6}$"`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Specifies the external financial institution identification scheme name code in the format of character string.|enum (UKSortCode)|

<a name="setupsimplepayment-debtoraccount"></a>
**DebtorAccount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|maxLength 34 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 34`|string|
|**Name**  <br>*optional*|maxLength 70 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 70`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.|enum (BBAN)|

<a name="setupsimplepayment-debtoragent"></a>
**DebtorAgent**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|United Kingdom (UK) Sort Code - identifies British financial institutions on the British national clearing systems. The sort code is assigned by the Association for Payments and Clearing Services (APACS).  <br>**Pattern** : `"^SC[0-9]{6,6}$"`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Specifies the external financial institution identification scheme name code in the format of character string.|enum (UKSortCode)|

<a name="setupsimplepayment-instructedamount"></a>
**InstructedAmount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Amount**  <br>*required*|**Pattern** : `"^-?\\d{1,13}\\.\\d{1,5}$"`|string|
|**Currency**  <br>*required*|A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[A-Z]{3}$"`|string|


#### Responses

|HTTP Code|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**200**|Payment setup successfully|[Simple Payment Setup Post Response](#simple-payment-setup-post-response)|
|**400**|Bad Request|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|
|**401**|Unauthorized|[HTTP 401 Error](#http-401-error)|
|**403**|Forbidden|[Simple Payment Setup Post 403 Response](#simple-payment-setup-post-403-response)|
|**409**|Conflict|[Simple Payment Setup Post 409 Response](#simple-payment-setup-post-409-response)|
|**500**|Internal Server Error|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|

<a name="simple-payment-setup-post-response"></a>
**Simple Payment Setup Post Response**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**EndToEndIdentification**  <br>*required*|Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction. It can be included in several messages related to the transaction.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**IntentID**  <br>*required*|Intent ID is the ASPSP identifier for the payment setup intent  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|

<a name="http-500-error"></a>
**HTTP 500 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The payment infrastructure is busy or unavailable.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (500)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (InternalServerError)|

<a name="http-401-error"></a>
**HTTP 401 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The request is unauthorised. Do not resubmit the request.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (401)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (Unauthorised)|

<a name="simple-payment-setup-post-403-response"></a>
**Simple Payment Setup Post 403 Response**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The payer sort code is not valid - is closed, does not exist, or is not valid for the scheme., The payer account is not valid - is closed, does not exist, or is not valid for the scheme., The payee sort code is not valid - is closed, does not exist, or is not valid for the scheme., The payee account is not valid - is closed, does not exist, or is not valid for the scheme., The amount is not valid - exceeds scheme limit., The date is too far in the future., The scheme has rejected payment for an unspecified reason., The sending institution has rejected payment for an unspecified reason., The receiving institution has rejected payment for an unspecified reason.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (403)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (InvalidPayerSortCode, InvalidPayerAccount, InvalidPayeeSortCode, InvalidPayeeAccount, InvalidAmount, InvalidExecutionDate, SchemeReject, SendingInstitutionReject, ReceivingInstitutionReject)|

<a name="simple-payment-setup-post-409-response"></a>
**Simple Payment Setup Post 409 Response**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The sending institution has rejected payment for an unspecified reason.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (409)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (SendingInstitutionReject)|

<a name="http-500-error"></a>
**HTTP 500 Error**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**description**  <br>*required*|enum (The payment infrastructure is busy or unavailable.)|
|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (500)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (InternalServerError)|


#### Consumes

* `application/prs.openbanking.rwdata.v0.1+json`


#### Produces

* `application/prs.openbanking.rwdata.v0.1+json`


#### Tags

* Simple Payment


#### Security

|Type|Name|Scopes|
|---|---|---|
|**oauth2**|**[OAuth2Security](#oauth2security)**|payments:setup,payments:recurring_setup|

#### Parameters

|---|---|---|---|

|HTTP Code|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**200**|Payment successfully deleted|[Simple Payment Cancel Delete 200 Response](#simple-payment-cancel-delete-200-response)|
|**400**|Bad Request|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|
|**401**|Unauthorized|[HTTP 401 Error](#http-401-error)|
|**500**|Internal Server Error|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|

<a name="submitsimplepayment"></a>
### Submit a simple payment
```
PUT /payments/simple/{IntentID}/submit
```


#### Description
Submit a previously setup simple payment (e.g. single immediate domestic payments, single future dated payment , single e-commerce payment or simple recurring payment)


#### Parameters

|Type|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|---|
|**Path**|**IntentID**  <br>*required*|Intent ID of the previously set up simple payment|string|


#### Body parameter
Body parameters needed to submit a simple payment

*Name* : body  
*Flags* : required


|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**CreditorAccount**  <br>*required*|Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction.|[CreditorAccount](#submitsimplepayment-creditoraccount)|
|**CreditorAgent**  <br>*required*|Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor.|[CreditorAgent](#submitsimplepayment-creditoragent)|
|**DebtorAccount**  <br>*optional*|Unambiguous identification of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry will be made as a result of the transaction.|[DebtorAccount](#submitsimplepayment-debtoraccount)|
|**DebtorAgent**  <br>*optional*|Financial institution servicing an account for the debtor.|[DebtorAgent](#submitsimplepayment-debtoragent)|
|**EndToEndIdentification**  <br>*required*|Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction. It can be included in several messages related to the transaction.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**InstructedAmount**  <br>*required*|Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party. Usage: This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.|[InstructedAmount](#submitsimplepayment-instructedamount)|
|**InstructionIdentification**  <br>*required*|Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction. Usage: the  instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**IntentID**  <br>*required*|Intent ID is the ASPSP identifier for the payment setup intent  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**MerchantCategoryCode**  <br>*optional*|Category code conform to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction.  <br>**Length** : `3 - 4`|string|
|**PaymentType**  <br>*optional*|Specifies the Open Banking payment type requested|enum (FutureDated, Immediate, RecurringAnnually, RecurringMonthly, RecurringQuarterly, RecurringWeekly)|
|**RemittanceInformation**  <br>*optional*|Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.  <br>**Length** : `1 - 140`|string|
|**RequestExecutionDate**  <br>*optional*|Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment. Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. If payment by cheque, the date when the cheque must be generated by the bank.  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[0-9]{4}-(0[1-9]\|(1[0\|1\|2]))-((0[1-9])\|((1\|2)[0-9])\|(30\|31))$"`|string|

<a name="submitsimplepayment-creditoraccount"></a>
**CreditorAccount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|maxLength 34 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 34`|string|
|**Name**  <br>*optional*|maxLength 70 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 70`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.|enum (BBAN)|

<a name="submitsimplepayment-creditoragent"></a>
**CreditorAgent**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|United Kingdom (UK) Sort Code - identifies British financial institutions on the British national clearing systems. The sort code is assigned by the Association for Payments and Clearing Services (APACS).  <br>**Pattern** : `"^SC[0-9]{6,6}$"`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Specifies the external financial institution identification scheme name code in the format of character string.|enum (UKSortCode)|

<a name="submitsimplepayment-debtoraccount"></a>
**DebtorAccount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|maxLength 34 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 34`|string|
|**Name**  <br>*optional*|maxLength 70 text  <br>**Length** : `1 - 70`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.|enum (BBAN)|

<a name="submitsimplepayment-debtoragent"></a>
**DebtorAgent**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Identification**  <br>*required*|United Kingdom (UK) Sort Code - identifies British financial institutions on the British national clearing systems. The sort code is assigned by the Association for Payments and Clearing Services (APACS).  <br>**Pattern** : `"^SC[0-9]{6,6}$"`|string|
|**SchemeName**  <br>*required*|Specifies the external financial institution identification scheme name code in the format of character string.|enum (UKSortCode)|

<a name="submitsimplepayment-instructedamount"></a>
**InstructedAmount**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**Amount**  <br>*required*|**Pattern** : `"^-?\\d{1,13}\\.\\d{1,5}$"`|string|
|**Currency**  <br>*required*|A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'  <br>**Pattern** : `"^[A-Z]{3}$"`|string|


#### Responses

|HTTP Code|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**200**|Payment executed or ready for scheme to execute.|[Simple Payment Submit Put 200 Response](#simple-payment-submit-put-200-response)|
|**202**|Payment execution instruction accepted.|[Simple Payment Submit Put 202 Response](#simple-payment-submit-put-202-response)|
|**400**|Bad Request|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|
|**401**|Unauthorized|[HTTP 401 Error](#http-401-error)|
|**403**|Forbidden|[Simple Payment Submit Put 403 Response](#simple-payment-submit-put-403-response)|
|**409**|Conflict|[Simple Payment Submit Put 409 Response](#simple-payment-submit-put-409-response)|
|**500**|Internal Server Error|[HTTP 500 Error](#http-500-error)|

<a name="simple-payment-submit-put-200-response"></a>
**Simple Payment Submit Put 200 Response**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**PaymentStatus**  <br>*required*|enum (ReadyforExecution)|
|**PaymentStatusDescription**  <br>*optional*|enum (Payment execution instruction accepted.)|

<a name="simple-payment-submit-put-202-response"></a>
**Simple Payment Submit Put 202 Response**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**PaymentStatus**  <br>*required*|enum (InstructionReceived)|
|**PaymentStatusDescription**  <br>*required*|enum (Payment execution instruction accepted.)|

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|

|**status**  <br>*required*|enum (403)|
|**title**  <br>*required*|enum (InvalidPayerSortCode, InvalidPayerAccount, InvalidPayeeSortCode, InvalidPayeeAccount, InvalidAmount, InvalidExecutionDate, SchemeReject, SendingInstitutionReject, ReceivingInstitutionReject)|

|Name|Schema|

<a name="getcomplexpaymentstatus"></a>
### Gets status for a complex payment
```
GET /payments/status/{GlobalIntentID}/all
```


#### Description
Gets status for a previously submitted complex payment, all payments (if many) instructions status will be returned


#### Parameters

|Type|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|---|
|**Path**|**GlobalIntentID**  <br>*required*|Global Intent ID of the previously set up complex payment|string|


#### Responses

|HTTP Code|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**200**|Global Payments Status|< [Response 200](#getcomplexpaymentstatus-response-200) > array|

<a name="getcomplexpaymentstatus-response-200"></a>
**Response 200**

|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**IntentID**  <br>*required*|Intent ID is the ASPSP identifier for the payment setup intent  <br>**Length** : `1 - 35`|string|
|**PaymentStatus**  <br>*required*||enum (AwaitingAuthorisation, ReadyforSubmission, ReadyforExecution, SendingInstitutionExecution, SchemeExecution, ReceivingInstitutionExecution, ExecutionComplete, ExecutionFailure, Cancelled)|
|**PaymentStatusDescription**  <br>*required*||enum (Payment request requires further authorisation to progress., Payment request is authorised and ready for submission., Payment executed or ready for scheme to execute., Payment is being executed by the sending institution., Payment has been passed from sending institution to scheme for processing., Payment has passed from scheme to receiving institution for processing., Payment has been applied to receiving account and is complete., Payment to receving account has failed., Payment instruction cancelled.)|


#### Produces

* `application/prs.openbanking.rwdata.v0.1+json`


#### Tags

* Complex Payment


#### Security

|Type|Name|Scopes|
|---|---|---|
|**oauth2**|**[OAuth2Security](#oauth2security)**|payments:complex_status,payments:recurring_status|


***

<a name="getsimplepaymentstatus"></a>
### Gets status for a payment
```
GET /payments/status/{IntentID}
```


#### Description
Gets status for a previously submitted  payment (single instruction within a complex or simple  payment)


#### Parameters

|Type|Name|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|---|
|**Path**|**IntentID**  <br>*required*|Intent ID of the previously set up simple payment|string|


#### Responses

|HTTP Code|Description|Schema|
|---|---|---|
|**200**|Payment Status|[Simple Payment Status GET 200 Response](#simple-payment-status-get-200-response)|

<a name="simple-payment-status-get-200-response"></a>
**Simple Payment Status GET 200 Response**

|Name|Schema|
|---|---|
|**PaymentStatus**  <br>*required*|enum (AwaitingAuthorisation, ReadyforSubmission, ReadyforExecution, SendingInstitutionExecution, SchemeExecution, ReceivingInstitutionExecution, ExecutionComplete, ExecutionFailure, Cancelled)|
|**PaymentStatusDescription**  <br>*required*|enum (Payment request requires further authorisation to progress., Payment request is authorised and ready for submission., Payment executed or ready for scheme to execute., Payment is being executed by the sending institution., Payment has been passed from sending institution to scheme for processing., Payment has passed from scheme to receiving institution for processing., Payment has been applied to receiving account and is complete., Payment to receving account has failed., Payment instruction cancelled.)|


#### Produces

* `application/prs.openbanking.rwdata.v0.1+json`


#### Tags

* Complex Payment
* Simple Payment


#### Security

|Type|Name|Scopes|
|---|---|---|
|**oauth2**|**[OAuth2Security](#oauth2security)**|payments:status,payments:recurring_status|






<a name="securityscheme"></a>
## Security

<a name="oauth2security"></a>
### OAuth2Security
*Type* : oauth2  
*Flow* : password  
*Token URL* : /token


|Name|Description|
|---|---|
|payments:setup|ability to create/setup a payment, not to be confused with submit|
|payments:submit|submit a payment|
|payments:cancel|cancel a future dated/recurring payment|
|payments:status|allows to retrieve status of a payment|
|payments:recurring_setup|ability to create/setup a payment, not to be confused with submit|
|payments:recurring_submit|submit a future dated/recurring payment|
|payments:recurring_cancel|cancel a future dated/recurring payment|
|payments:recurring_status|allows to retrieve status of a future dated/recurring payment|
|payments:complex_setup|ability to create/setup a complex payment, not to be confused with submit|
|payments:complex_submit|submit a complex payment|
|payments:complex_cancel|cancel a future dated/recurring complex payment|
|payments:complex_status|allows to retrieve status of a complex payment|
